attributes.action: Make it unacceptable for MPs to jeer and mock during House of Commons debates
attributes.additional_details: If we want our children to learn to respect others views and opinions, then we need those who lead our country to set a good example. Instead, they promote aggressive bullying tactics that are designed to throw those speaking off their train of thought, no matter how valuable the issue being discussed is. This is not the type of democracy that I want guiding this country, making key decisions about my day to day life. There must be another way, agree to disagree, but work together!
attributes.background: Watching prime ministers questions, I'm greatly disheartened and disillusioned by the deeply offensive and immature behaviour that is displayed by those in charge of our country. Leaders should set an example for younger generations, but currently they'd be on the red traffic light in my classroom.
